page.title: 02LAMPHEY PALACE (LAMPHEY)
page.content: Lamphey Palace was the country house of the Bishop of St.David's.The Bishop was also the Lord of Lamphey.He owned all the land and all the people had to work for him.If they disobeyed him they would be punished on the green outside the church.In the grounds were fish ponds.The Bishop would fish there.Everyone had to eat fish three days a week.The waste from the kitchens was thrown into a stream and would float to the fish ponds.The fish ate it and became fat.He also had an enclosed deer park.If anyone was caught killing deer he would probably be killed himself.While the Bishop had a good time the villagers had exactly the opposite.The Palace was later owned by the Earls of Essex,the Orielton and Mathias families.It is now a ruin and administered by {Cadw } for tourists.
